DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to cancer that is increasing in scope or severity as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have progression
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progression as documented by: Two consecutively rising PSA values, above the baseline, at a minimum of 1-week intervals, appearance of one or more new lesions on bone scan and progressive measurable disease by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has GIST demonstrated progression by RECIST v1.1 within the past 12 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the expansion cohort and has urothelial cancer or renal cell carcinoma does patient have progressive disease defined as new or progressive lesions on cross-sectional imaging and at least one measurable site of disease (according to RECIST criteria)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient's disease progressed following standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the expansion cohort and has urothelial cancer or renal cell carcinoma does patient have progressive disease defined as new or progressive lesions on cross-sectional imaging and at least one measurable site of disease (according to RECIST criteria) or bone disease by NaF PET/CT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of disease progression per RECIST1.1 prior to enrollment or have evidence of cancer-related pain requiring symptom management with narcotic analgesics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progression as documented by: Two consecutively rising PSA values, above the baseline, at a minimum of 1-week intervals, appearance of one or more new lesions on bone scan or progressive measurable disease by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced disease progression after treatment with 1 or more prior chemotherapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, did patient have progressive disease on Sorafenib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have radiologic evidence of disease progression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has WHO grade II glioma, does patient have progression as defined by one of the following: Development of new lesions or increase of enhancement (radiological evidence of malignant transformation) OR a 25% increase of the T2 or FLAIR non-enhancing lesion on stable or increasing doses of corticosteroids compared with baseline scan or best response after initiation of therapy, not attributable to radiation effect or to comorbid events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progression as documented by: Two consecutively rising PSA values, above the baseline, at a minimum of 1-week intervals, appearance of one or more new lesions on bone scan or progressive disease by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive cancer at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive disease defined by any of the following: Castrate resistant disease as defined by PCWG-3 criteria; an increase in PSA on two successive determination at least one week apart and PSA levels greater than or equal to 2 ng/mL (only the screening PSA needs to be greater than or equal to 2 ng/mL) and serum testosterone less than 50 ng/dL; Soft tissue progression as defined by RECIST version 1.1; Bone disease progression as defined by PCWG-3 criteria including the development of two or more new lesions on bone scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a baseline PSA level of 1 ng/mL or higher with evidence of progressively increasing PSA values (two consecutive increases over the previous reference value)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive disease based on RECIST Criteria, Version 1.1 evidenced with CT scans/MRI obtained within 24 months from enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Randomized portion: If patient has unresectable, metastatic and measurable ASPS, does patient have clinical evidence of disease progression (including history and increasing physical symptoms)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current disease progression according to PCWG3 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented disease progression per RECIST 1.1 within 12 months of initiation of the study protocol?

DataElement.changeDescription: 1/10/17 tt, approved/released. 11/30/16 tt, 9984.  03/08/2018 fixed apostrophe in Question text DW
